text: Alternanthera filifolia is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to the Galápagos Islands. This plant is limited to the Galápagos, but it is common there in lowlands and coastal shrublands. It is variable in morphology, forming shrubs 0.5 to 1.5 meters tall. ==References== filifolia Category:Endemic flora of Galápagos Category:Least concern biota of South America Category:Least concern plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Alternanthera filifolia
